Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Berlin”
Reviews.Author: PhilandPhylUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just about 100 meters from Konstancestrasse U Bahn. The whole of Berlin is covered by the U & S Bahn trains. Tip- Buy a Berlin Welcome card for 25 Euros, it gives 3 days unlimited travel on buses and trains right out to Potsdam and the airports, also gives great discounts on Berlin attractions. The hotel staff were very nice and spoke good English, breakfast was excellent, cold meats, cheeses, salad, breads etc, all served in spacious dining room. Our room was very large with a beautiful ceiling and chandaleir. It also had a seperate couch and work table. The room was not modern but was tastefully decorated and very clean. The room was well heated despite the freezing tempratures outside. We had a large corner bath in a seperate bathroom, which was very nice but took about 30 minutes to fill. The bathroom also had a hair shower attached to bath with a short pipe. As the bath took so long to fill, in the mornings we had to hold the hair shower over each other to get a shower. All good clean fun and it made for a memorable hoilday experience. If you didn`t know your room mate too well before your stay, you will afterwards! A very nice hotel full of character and charm that you don`t get in the big chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “best find of the trip”
Reviews.Author: EEM88
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wittelsbach in Berlin was definitely the best deal of our whole three week trip. Located in an old mansion, but now equipped with an elevator, this hotel is located just two minutes walk from the UBahn (subway) and ten minutes walk from the Kurfürstendamm. We had a spacious room and a four piece bath, and every morning we were treated to a fantastic breakfast buffet, which included everything from yoghurt to juice, cheese and cold cuts, cereals, breads, tea, coffee and cake. And for all of this we paid €49 a night for both of us. The only problems: no internet in the room. For that we had to come down to the dining room and pay €5 a day extra.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: toronto4567
Reviews.Content: we had made reservations at the Comet Hotel. upon our arrival we were informed that they did not have a room for us but would transfer us to the Wittelsbach. Elizabeth, the receptionist at Wittelsback, was waiting for us and did everything possible to make us comfortable and welcome. we were in a rather small triple room the first night, but were up graded to a suite for the rest of our stay. the breakfast was much better than in most places. a good, well-located hotel with excellent personnel. an extra thank-you to Elizabeth!

Reviews.Title: “+ and - .....”
Reviews.Author: humbledbyexperience
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff. VERY friendly and helpful. Rooms are outdated, but adequate. It was hot in Berlin (90's) and very hot in the rooms. No fans available. Breakfast is good for most people. If you tend to be vegetarian, there is a store around the corner with soymilk, fruits, vegetables, etc. They require all CASH up front. This means that is you change you mind, you can't go anywhere else. It also meant I had to carry lots of cash around. The internet was an extra 5 euros a day, but did not work for me. It did work for some others.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Coxiella
Reviews.Content: First of all - the pictures shown in the internet are misleading. I have seen two rooms and they looked very different: smaller and a kind of shabby. I have booked a single room and was given a very small room right behind the reception. There was a gap between door and wall, so you could hear everything from the reception desk including the radio. Sleeping was impossible, so I asked for another room. The receptionist first told me that they are fully booked. As I wanted to check out and move to another hotel suddenly there was another room. The smell of smoke was unbearable, the hotel homepage tells about nonsmoking rooms... I ended up in Motel One and highly redcommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant brilliant brilliant”
Reviews.Author: therock59
Reviews.Content: hotel and staff were excellent. The breakfast was very filling and a very good selection. It is in an ideal location and would definately recommend this hotel to anyone and will definately go back .

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Hollie31
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a cheapy so I honestly didn't expect much but was pleasantly suprised. The faded Tyrol type kitch decor was quite endearing. The room was large with a little fridge but no kettle. Clean. Breakfast was great apart from the coffee machine. Plenty of hot water. I am allergic to feathers so asked for another pillow and that wasn't a problem. Very close to the nearest underground station. A nice area with older buildings but very dimly lit streets at night. Now that I know my way it won't be a problem but I was glad that I wasn't on my own the first night whilst looking for the place. If you're a woman travelling alone and arriving at night I would recommend taking the tube to K'damn ( main street not far away) and then getting a taxi to the hotel. Have some cash on you because none the little shops in the area would take my card. A small supermarket called "Kaisers" just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “affordable relaxed elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: clariyt
Reviews.Content: we stayed for four nights - nothing bad to say about this hotel. It was better than advertised, our room was spacious, comfortable with good ensuite shower and loo. Beds very comfortable. Hotel staff very friendly, and extremely helpful. Breakfast was exceptionally good, wi-fi free in lobby as advertised, and it worked! Situated in a quiet side street close to U Bahn station - only a short journey to the centre of town, we'd recommend this hotel to anyone without hesitation.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel-Pension Wittelsbach
HotelInfo.Address: 22 Wittelsbacherstrasse | Wilmersdorf, 10707 Berlin, Germany
